PENAL.Definition: relating to the punishment of criminals

LOAF.Definition: bread that is shaped and baked in one piece

HOVER OVER.Definition: put your mouse over for a short period

BANISHING.Definition: sending away from a country or city as a punishment

DETERRENT.Definition: something that makes others less likely to do something

DETER.Definition: to stop someone from doing something by showing them that it will have bad results

PROPORTION.Definition: the number of something, when compared to the whole

SHILLINGS.Definition: a unit of money used in Britain until 1971

EPIDEMIC.Definition: the appearance of a disease or virus in large amounts of people at the same time

STARVING TO DEATH.Definition: dying through not having enough food

CHOLERA.Definition: a serious infection of the bowels, normally caused by drinking or eating infected water or food

RIFE.Definition: if something is rife, it happens a lot

PLANTATION.Definition: a large farm, especially in the Americas, where a particular type of crop is grown

PLANTATIONS.Definition: large farms, especially in the Americas, where a particular type of crop is grown

HOUSE.Definition: (verb) to provide someone with a place to live or stay

CLAIMED.Definition: to say that something belongs to someone

SETTLEMENTS.Definition: a group of houses built in a place where people didn't live before

DESCENDANT.Definition: someone who is related to you and born after you, e.g. child, grandchild

NOTORIOUSLY.Definition: in a way that is well known for something bad

GRANTED.Definition: used when you know that something is true
